newsitem.title: USA: Make Chapter 12 bankruptcy law permanent - Senator.
newsitem.headline: Make Chapter 12 bankruptcy law permanent - Senator.

text.p: U.S. Senator Charles Grassley, author of the Chapter 12 bankruptcy law, said Tuesday he would seek permanent status for the law, now due to expire in 1998.
Created in 1986, Chapter 12 deals with farm bankruptcies.

"Chapter 12 proves that common sense legislation can make a positive difference. Congress should make permanent this effective tool which has helped so many family farmers retain stewardship of their land and continue in the business of farming," Grassley, Iowa Republican, said in a statement.

One provision of Chapter 12 blocks creditors from foreclosing if the farmer is able to make rental payments. Another provision does not require farmers to obtain creditor approval of their reorganization plans upon application.
Grassley said Congress was likely to consider bankruptcy reform legislation this year.
